Subject: Reactor with constant temperature and pressure
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=211891685; y=JZl-8oJMkHW-maesGEcBVI8nMLuLElUK4id-deKoTWSajZsXVg
X-Yahoo-Profile: csmnofbobs

Hello, this is Jeff Miller
I am trying to modify reactor-1 to do a constant temperature and 
pressure calculation for N2O reacting with with C2H6.  To do this, I 
am making the reservoir have the same temperature as the initial 
temperature of the gas in the reactor, and then including a very large 
heat transfer coefficient for the wall between the reservoir and the 
reactor.  The problem is that when I include the heat transfer 
coefficient, the initial temperature of the gas in the reactor jumps 
to about 400 K higher than the temperature I specify.  What could be 
the cause of this?
Thank you anyone who can help, and thanks again to Dr. Goodwin for the 
tutorial at the School of Mines.
Jeff Miller
